cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn N-NW tonight, then NE toward the Florida Big Bend and cross the peninsula into the Atlantic, then accelerate NE parallel to the U.S. southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – interests in central and northern Florida advised to monitor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially Big Bend and northern peninsula, later coastal GA/SC/NC
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a low (≤11%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds Thursday–Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of the peninsula where the port is located
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, creating a flooding and drainage concern for the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Thunderstorms, lightning, and short-notice squalls could intermittently halt cargo and crane operations
